Operation 'CreateSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint but omits what the operation actually does, what inputs are required, what is returned, and the timing context for segment population. Added clarity on inputs (segment configuration), outputs (segment object), and side effects (contact population timing) for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Segment `name` has to be unique. A user can not create a new segment with an existing segment name.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new segment for audience segmentation in Marketing Campaigns. Requires a unique segment name; duplicate names will be rejected. Accepts segment configuration including name, query criteria, and optional parent list IDs. Returns the created segment object with ID and metadata. The segment will begin populating with matching contacts within 15 minutes for standard criteria, or approximately 30 minutes for engagement-based criteria.
data.reasoning: Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint but omits what the operation actually does, what inputs are required, what is returned, and the timing context for segment population. Added clarity on inputs (segment configuration), outputs (segment object), and side effects (contact population timing) for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'ListSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is generic. The description, while detailed, uses a complex table format that is difficult for AI agents to parse. Simplified the filtering logic into clear, actionable language explaining each parameter's purpose and the expected behavior, making it easier for AI agents to determine when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of segments.**

The query param `parent_list_ids` is treated as a filter.  Any match will be returned.  Zero matches will return a response code of 200 with an empty `results` array.

`parent_list_ids` | `no_parent_list_id` | `ids` | `result`
-----------------:|:--------------------:|:-------------:|:-------------:
empty | false | empty | all segments values
list_ids | false | empty | segments filtered by list_ids values
list_ids |true | empty | segments filtered by list_ids and segments with no parent list_ids empty
empty | true | empty | segments with no parent list_ids
anything | anything | ids | segments with matching segment ids |
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve list of segments with optional filtering
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all segments or filtered segments based on query parameters. Supports filtering by parent list IDs and/or specific segment IDs. The `parent_list_ids` parameter filters segments by associated contact lists, the `no_parent_list_id` parameter includes segments with no parent list, and the `ids` parameter retrieves specific segments by ID. Returns a 200 response with a `results` array containing matching segments; an empty array is returned if no matches are found. Useful for AI agents to discover available segments for targeting or automation.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic. The description, while detailed, uses a complex table format that is difficult for AI agents to parse. Simplified the filtering logic into clear, actionable language explaining each parameter's purpose and the expected behavior, making it easier for AI agents to determine when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'UpdateSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint and doesn't explain what the operation does, what can be updated, or what is returned. Added clarity on the PATCH behavior (partial updates), the segment ID requirement, return value, and the timing for contact re-evaluation after criteria changes.

data.current_description: Segment `name` has to be unique. A user can not create a new segment with an existing segment name.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing segment identified by segment ID. Supports partial updates to segment properties such as name and query criteria. Segment names must be unique; attempting to update to a duplicate name will be rejected. Returns the updated segment object with refreshed metadata. Changes to segment criteria will trigger a refresh of matching contacts within 15 minutes for standard criteria, or approximately 30 minutes for engagement-based criteria.
data.reasoning: Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint and doesn't explain what the operation does, what can be updated, or what is returned. Added clarity on the PATCH behavior (partial updates), the segment ID requirement, return value, and the timing for contact re-evaluation after criteria changes.

message: Operation 'DeleteSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects, not_actionable. Original summary lacks capitalization consistency. Description is too minimal and doesn't explain the side effects of deletion (impact on automations, Single Sends, etc.) or the response behavior. Added details about what happens to associated resources and the expected HTTP response to help AI agents understand the full implications of this destructive operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a segment by ID.**
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a segment from Marketing Campaigns by segment ID. The segment and all associated metadata will be permanently removed. Contacts previously in the segment will not be affected. Automations and Single Sends using this segment will no longer be able to target it. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks capitalization consistency. Description is too minimal and doesn't explain the side effects of deletion (impact on automations, Single Sends, etc.) or the response behavior. Added details about what happens to associated resources and the expected HTTP response to help AI agents understand the full implications of this destructive operation.

message: Operation 'RefreshSegment' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and actionable. Description lacks important details about what the refresh operation does (re-evaluates contacts), the expected response code (202 Accepted), timing expectations, and the use case for manual refresh. Added these details to help AI agents understand the asynchronous nature of the operation and when it should be used.

data.current_description: Manually refresh a segment by segment ID.
data.description_suggestion: Manually triggers a refresh of segment membership for the specified segment ID. This forces an immediate re-evaluation of all contacts against the segment's criteria, updating the segment's contact list and sample data. Returns a 202 Accepted response indicating the refresh operation has been queued. The refresh process typically completes within 15 minutes for standard criteria or approximately 30 minutes for engagement-based criteria. Useful when you need updated segment data without waiting for the automatic hourly refresh cycle.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description lacks important details about what the refresh operation does (re-evaluates contacts), the expected response code (202 Accepted), timing expectations, and the use case for manual refresh. Added these details to help AI agents understand the asynchronous nature of the operation and when it should be used.
